alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 7:52PM EST until February 07 at 3:40AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Milledgeville affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Baldwin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Milledgeville. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs upstream and downstream from the gage located around one half mile upstream from the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. Low lying portions of woodlands and pasture in the natural flood plain will begin to flood. This will include portions of the sidewalks in the Oconee River Greenway Park just downstream from the bridge. Sinclair Dam will have one to two gates open to reach this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 23.6 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening to 13.1 feet. - Flood stage is 22 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
